page.title: 19A look back
page.content: In this area the population is now concentrated in the two villages of Mosstodloch and Fochabers. They have grown extensively while the hinterland i.e. the farms have been depleted of families. The coming of mechanisation on the farm means that one man and a tractor can now work the land previously requiring five men and ten horses. One combined harvester can do in a day what it took several workers several weeks to achieve. Social life now revolves around the village hall where people from all walks of life gather. The farm worker shares the village life, no longer living in a tied house on the farm, receiving his termly meal,sticks and coal supplies but getting a weekly wage like his neighbours.
